alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 17 at 3:17PM HST until January 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .As the north-northwest (340-350 degree) swell fades, a west- northwest (300-310 degree) swell will overlap, maintaining large surf along most north facing shores and boosting surf along select west facing shores through Thursday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 15 to 20 feet along north facing shores, 12 to 16 feet along west facing shores except 6 to 8 feet for west Big Island. * WHERE...North facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai and Maui. West facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, Molokai and the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
